title: Calories in 1/2 Cup Steamed Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in 1/2 cup steamed rice, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked long-grain white rice, steamed without added fat, salt, or seasonings; approximately 79 g per 1/2 cup.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, cooking method, water absorption, and portion measurement. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1/2 cup steamed white rice provides about 103 kcal and 22 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup steamed rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 103 kcal for 1/2 cup cooked white rice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 1/2 cup steamed rice?
faqs.a: About 22 g total carbs, with 0.3 g fiber and negligible sugars.

faqs.q: Is steamed rice high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only about 2 g protein per 1/2 cup; it's mostly carbs.

faqs.q: How does brown rice compare to white steamed rice?
faqs.a: Brown has similar calories (~108 kcal per 1/2 cup) but more fiber (1.8 g).

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in rice?
faqs.a: Steamed is low-fat; frying or adding oil can increase calories by 30-50 per 1/2 cup.
